message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item that's worth $12000 to you. I'm willing to make a fair offer to get us started. My initial offer is $18000 for the product.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $14000. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand that you're looking to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $14000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. My counteroffer is $16500 for the product.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above that. I'm thinking more along the lines of $14500. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.
I understand you're still a bit above my previous offer, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to be closer to my minimum price. My next counteroffer is $16000 for the product.

I appreciate your willingness to make another concession, but I'm still a bit above your latest offer. I'm thinking more along the lines of $15200. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. However, I still need to make a profit. My next counteroffer is $16500, which is my last offer. I'm willing to meet you at $16500, but I won't go any lower.

I understand you're trying to make a profit, but I'm not willing to pay $16500. I'm willing to meet you at $15500, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. If not, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand you're trying to negotiate, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $15500. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I need to be closer to my minimum price. My next counteroffer is $16250 for the product, which is my final offer. I'm not willing to go any lower.
